text: Milton "Milt, Curly" Brink (November 26, 1910 – October 31, 1999) was an American ice hockey player. He played 5 games in the NHL, all with the Chicago Black Hawks. Brink spent most of his ice hockey career in the American Hockey Association where he played a combined 5 seasons. ==Career statistics== Regular season Playoffs Season Team League GP G A Pts PIM GP G A Pts PIM 1931-31 Boston Cubs CAHL 5 1 0 1 0 1 0 0 0 0 1932-33 Eveleth Rangers CHL - - - - - - - - - - 1933-34 Eveleth Rangers CHL - 17 17 34 10 - - - - - 1934-35 Eveleth Rangers CHL 35 12 18 30 10 - - - - - 1935-36 Kansas City Greyhounds AHA 45 9 20 29 4 - - - - - 1936-37 Kansas City Greyhounds AHA 2 0 1 1 0 - - - - - 1936-37 Minneapolis Millers AHA 11 0 2 2 4 - - - - - 1936–37 Chicago Black Hawks NHL 5 0 0 0 0 - - - - - 1937-38 St. Paul Saints AHA 48 8 26 34 6 - - - - - 1938-39 Wichita Skyhawks AHA 5 0 1 1 0 - - - - - NHL totals 5 0 0 0 0 - - - - - ==Other websites== * Category:1910 births Category:1999 deaths Category:American Hockey Association (1926–42) players Category:American ice hockey centers Category:Chicago Blackhawks players Category:Sportspeople from Minnesota Category:People from Hibbing, Minnesota
